And I'm very appreciating if you =

--- In junit@yahoogroups.c=
om, "j_cumps" <j_cumps@...> wrote:
> You have to use your own XSL styleshee=
t in stead of the ones from 
Ant.
> 
> If you use the single page report, y=
ou need to provide your own 
junit-
> noframes.xsl stylesheet.
> If you use=
 the framed report, you need your own junit-frames.xsl.
> 
> 
> Ant writes =
all your system and error output to it's TEST-xxx.xml 
file.
> But it write=
s it at testsuite level, not at testmethod level.
> 
> If you prefix your o=
utput in your tests with 
> [testcaseclassname.testmethodname], you can cun=
ningly forge an xls 
> stylesheet that only takes output relevant for the c=
urrent 
> testmethod, and write the output to the type column.
>
